intro: Monnina lingua, commonly known as the "tongue of the devil," is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
